features: NO SEAT LIKE A SERTA SEAT: Sit longer and more comfortably with the Serta Essential Computer Chair made of faux leather and mesh
FITS RIGHT IN: Armless style makes it easy to tuck this office chair under a desk or table
EXCEPTIONAL AIR FLOW: Designed with a breathable mesh back to keep you comfortable throughout the day
SIT YOUR WAY: Seat-height adjustment lever lets you find your ideal position
SMOOTH ROLLING: Multi-directional casters for easy mobility
body.description: Outfit your dorm room or home office with the Serta Essential Computer Chair. Whether you’re working or gaming, this faux leather and mesh desk chair gives you consistent comfort and support. The ergonomic chair features a breathable mesh back, keeping you cool as deadlines approach or the game intensifies. An adjustment lever lets you customize the seat height, and multi-directional casters allow for easy mobility. This armless office chair fits a variety of environments and tucks easily under a computer desk or table.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very easy to assemble and looks better than photos.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this chair to use in my sewing room. I put it together by myself in under 15 minutes. Honestly the directions were the easiest I have ever seen-very clear and direct. The box it came in was thick and substantial so there was no damage. Faux leather is thick and stitching tight. I highly recommend this for anyone who needs an armless chair. Very comfortable and adjustable too. The white is a soft cream color.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size for our home office area.
reviews.reviewText: Size, quality, comfort, sturdiness with 5 wheel base, make for an impressive chair for the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a decent chair, good value for the price. Seat is very comfortable, and it was super easy to assemble. Easy to adjust height, too. My only complaint is that the back is not adjustable, and when you lean back into the chair, you're leaning back too far. Small issue, maybe holding my body upright off the back will strengthen my core, lol. Overall a good chair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Super easy to assemble, great look and very comfortable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to assemble and oh, so comfortable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Basic task desk chair.
reviews.reviewText: Got this as an auxiliary desk chair. Specifically didn’t want bulky arm rests so this one did the trick.It adjusts up and down and swivels. However it does NOT recline. Seat padding is meh on this. The mesh back has a slight give so that’s ok.Lower back starts hurting after an hour or two sitting in it. May need to invest in a c-spine cushion to make it more tolerable.This chair is more of a basic task desk chair that’s not meant for comfort. I just like it bc it’s a smaller footprint than the traditional desk chairs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice chair for crafting
reviews.reviewText: Just the right size for my wife to use at her crafting table. Adjusts up and down easily. Base is super stable Great product at a fair price

Description here and on Wayfair says 250 lbs however, manufacturer indicates 275 for those who are interested.This is very classy looking chair.Supper easy to assemble in under 20 minutes.Includes Allen Key so absolutely no other tools needed.Leather look alike is quality and well stitched.Seat padding is thicker than expected. Should last well. It’s not cushiony so it has less chance of breaking down.All 5 claws are solid steel and welded together “no nuts or bolts” it’s very solid. Apart from the castors, the only plastic part is the chrome cover that drops down over the centre claw piece.No metal exposed parts where seating so I’m confused why another raised that being an issue.It glides effortlessly across our laminate floor and seat swings around, lifts up and down quietly and with ease.$229 is a fair price all considering.Not sure I’d use it for an office/home office use where you’d be sitting for hours at a time but, it’s certainly suitable for a few of hours. My main use will be for sewing or at my home desk during shorter periods while using MacBook.Very pleased with this purchase with only one exception, hence the 4 stars, it is not “made and assembled in North America”.If anything should change, I will be right back to update.Update June 2023 - chair is still as it was new without an issues whatsoever.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a bad chair, especially for the money, but not a great one.
reviews.reviewText: Seat part is comfortable, soft enough and the plastic has a nice texture. The back conforms well to the back, but leaning on it you will be supported by the bent tube steel. There is no option for allowing it to angle at all - the only control is height adjustment. In terms of chair for the dollar, it's not bad. The base is sturdy and the wheels roll well. However, I don't get the feeling it'll last particularly long, and more importantly I'm already thinking I need to replace it (I've had it for about 2 weeks now). So I will say that it's an ok chair, but I regret buying it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gift this chair to someone you really hate
reviews.reviewText: I've never owned a Serta bed but I can only they're filled with sharpened rocks because this is truly the most uncomfortable chair my arse has ever encountered. 'Ergonomic' is a joke. My back feels like I've been trying to clean under the oven for a week. I've give it 2 stars: 1 for being, unarguably, a chair. 2 for being 'easy to assemble' - if you urgently need the most uncomfortable chair in the world for enhanced interrogation, you will have this thing together in a jiffy.

Do not buy this if you will be sitting in it for long periods. The back has no padding so you get the metal frame digging into your back, and the bottom doesn't have much cushion. After a while of sitting on this you might as well be sitting on a wooden chair. However if you make the same mistake i did you can kinda fix the frame issue with a hoodie/sweater slipped over the top with one arm inside the other. and the bottom can be fixed with a pillow, looks ridiculous though.
It’s a nice looking chair but when sitting in it I feel like I’m leaning forward. Not too comfortable.
